item.title: The Crew 2: Fastest Cars, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Hypercars in The Crew 2 are the pinnacle of speed, delivering thrilling driving experiences in the open world.
  • With a roster of 538 vehicles, including top performers like the Bugatti Chiron Super Sport, Koenigsegg Agera R, and Saleen S7, the game offers a vast selection of high-performance cars.
  • The fastest hypercars in The Crew 2 can reach incredible top speeds exceeding 250 mph in their stock versions, with the potential for even greater speeds through upgrades.

If The Crew 2 players want pure speed, there is nothing better than a hypercar. These fantastic cars are the best at what they do and give the driver the most thrilling experience. The fact that these tools are fast and on the cutting edge also means they have many different kinds of technology. The game's hypercars utilize gasoline engines, sophisticated plug-in hybrids, and high-power electric automobiles to drive quickly.

Over the years, The Crew 2 's vehicle roster has expanded significantly, now boasting 538 cars for players to obtain and drive. Below are some of the fastest cars available in the game. Each of these top performers pushes the limits of what is possible in the name of performance. Each breaks the speed record to the vehicle hall of fame, giving a high-octane thrill experience.

Updated April 12th, 2025, by Vlad Mazanko: With a vast array of content and cars, plus a huge map to explore, The Crew 2 remains a standout open-world arcade racing title, alongside the newer Crew Motorfest . So far, no plans have been announced for a potential game delisting like The Crew anytime soon, so it's safe to assume The Crew 2 will stick around for players for quite some time.

The list of the fastest cars in The Crew 2 has been updated to expand the roster of top-speed rides, including additional stats and details for each option.

20 Porsche 918 Spyder & Porsche 911 GT1

Top Speed: 214+ mph

  • Cost to Buy: 806,399-839,999 Bucks
  • Performance Levels: 240

The Porsche 918 Spyder carries heavier, more powerful electric motors and more battery capacity than its rivals. It also made more of an effort to promote its 21st-century zero-emissions technology. Players can drive this automobile about 15 kilometers on electric power alone before recharging it. It follows the tradition of Porsche's supercars and is slightly more challenging to operate than the 718 Boxster, despite being a convertible.

However, the car's rawness and excitement in full-throttle mode come from its naturally aspirated V8 engine, perfect for racing games that need speed like The Crew 2 . The 918 Spyder's engine has 875 horsepower as well as four-wheel drive, allowing it to launch from a stop with pure ferocity. It may be cumbersome, but it can go quickly on the right track.

Another Porsche model worth mentioning is the Porsche 911 GT1 Strassenversion, a high-performance German automobile that has a top speed of over 190 mph (and can go even higher when properly upgraded). It has a 3.2-liter twin-turbocharged flat-6 engine that can produce 536 horsepower at 7,200 rpm.

19 Lamborghini Aventador, Veneno & Countach

Top Speed: 217+ mph

  • Cost to Buy: 635,599-1,234,799 Bucks
  • Performance Levels: 227-241

The Lamborghini Aventador LP700-4 is a two-door Italian sports coupe with a 6.5-liter V12 engine, which replaced the Murci√©lago as Lamborghini's flagship vehicle. Lamborghini started making the Aventador in 2011, with an intended production capacity of 4,000 units. By 2016, the company had produced over 5,000. This vehicle has a semi-automatic transmission with seven gears and a single clutch.

The LP 700-4 gets its "4" because an external Swedish company installed a four-wheel drive system, which is much better in terms of traction and handling. The "700" indicates the vehicle has 700 PS, equivalent to around 691 horsepower. The real world has well accepted the car, and Top Gear named it "Supercar of the Year." Lamborghini fans may also want to check out the Lamborghini Veneno and the Lamborghini Countach LPI 800-4, both capable of reaching a top speed of 220 mph in the game.

18 McLaren P1 & McLaren F1

Top Speed: 217+ mph

  • Cost to Buy: 674,799 Bucks
  • Performance Levels: 241-252

The McLaren P1 hypercar has a 3.8L twin-turbocharged V8 engine. For players to get it, they have to beat Tio Marquez. Players can obtain the P1 for free after defeating a boss, eliminating the need to spend any money or points to acquire it. McLaren changed the car to create the unique form known as the "Gold Line" Edition of the P1. Its name comes from the new body kit and silver paint job with gold lines. The game added it as part of the Into the Storm update. However, only the S7/E1 of the MotorPass can drive it.

Another notable McLaren for fans of the brand in The Crew 2 is the legendary McLaren F1, created from 1993 to 1998, which is a genuine replacement and has many of the same features. With a top speed of 239 mph, it remains one of the fastest cars in any game where the F1 has appeared over the years.

17 Bugatti Divo & Bugatti Centodieci

Top Speed: 217+ mph

  • Cost to Buy: 1,793,679-2,079,279 Bucks
  • Performance Levels: 275-281

The Bugatti Divo joins other Bugatti models, including the Centodieci, which boasts a top speed of over 236 mph, in The Crew 2 's impressive roster. This car's name comes from the French driver Albert Divo, who drove for Bugatti in the 1920s. The vehicle is similar to the Chiron but has better aerodynamics, giving it more downforce and a few minor visible changes that distinguish it. The Crew 2 marks the Bugatti Divo's debut in a cross-platform open-world racing game (excluding mobile). It has an 8.0L W16 engine under the hood that can produce 1,479 horsepower at 6,700 revs per minute.

The Crew 2 also offers a special Divo Magma Edition, which comes with a white paint job with orange lines, a unique hood, and an orange interior. This version led hypercar events from the Blazing Shot upgrade to the Chiron Super Sport 300+. The Emerald Storm Edition is another version of the Divo. It has the same customization options as the Magma Edition but has a green interior and a black paint job with green lining.

16 Ferrari Enzo & Ferrari Laferrari

Top Speed: 217+ mph

  • Cost to Buy: 1,287,999 Bucks
  • Performance Levels: 230-258

Among the numerous Ferrari vehicles in The Crew 2 , two models stand out as exceptional examples of speed and prestige: the Ferrari Enzo and the Ferrari LaFerrari. As the spiritual successor to the exclusive Enzo, the LaFerrari takes the Ferrari legacy to an even higher level of innovation and performance. Both hypercars effortlessly exceed 210 mph in top speed and boast incredible potential for further upgrades, pushing their performance to the absolute limit.

Known for their rarity and exclusivity, only 400 units of the Ferrari Enzo and 499 units of the Ferrari LaFerrari were ever produced, making driving them in The Crew 2 a uniquely satisfying and privileged experience. These Italian masterpieces are crafted with high-end materials, powered by engines that deliver unmistakably rich and noble sounds, and equipped with top-tier acceleration and braking capabilities. As two of the fastest and most exotic cars in the game, they embody Ferrari's tireless dedication to excellence. Unlocking the Ferrari LaFerrari, however, requires a significant commitment to the game, as players must reach Icon level 600 to earn it.

15 Nissan R3900 GT1 Road Version

Top Speed: 220+ mph

  • Cost to Buy: 815,359 Bucks
  • Performance Level: 233

The 1998 Nissan R390 GT1 Road Version is a dream come true for fans of Japanese engineering and motorsport history. Designed by Nissan's specialized Nismo division, this rare high-performance car was originally built for motorsport racing. The version available in The Crew 2 is the street-legal counterpart of the legendary R390 GT1 race car, with only a single unit ever produced.

Blending peak Nissan performance with retro motorsport aesthetics, the R390 GT1 Road Version boasts one of the highest top speeds among stock cars in The Crew 2 , reaching over 220 mph. Under the hood, it's powered by a 3.5L twin-turbocharged V8 engine (codenamed VRH35L) that generates an impressive 550 horsepower. Despite its raw power, the R390 GT1 offers remarkably smooth and responsive handling, embodying the precision and reliability synonymous with Nissan vehicles. Whether players chase speed records or savor its unique design, the R390 GT1 stands as an extraordinary piece of automotive engineering.

14 Ferrari 599XX Evo & Ferrari FXX K

Top Speed: 221+ mph

  • Cost to Buy: 622,159-890,400 Bucks
  • Performance Levels: 243-265

Enzo and LaFerrari aside, the Ferrari 599XX Evo and Ferrari FXX K (actually based on the LaFerrari) represent even more extreme modifications from the iconic manufacturer, surpassing everything it offers in The Crew 2 in terms of acceleration and top speed. Both cars are track-ready models from Ferrari's advanced XX program, which lets clients test cutting-edge tech in exchange for firsthand feedback. They pack extra horsepower over their "standard" counterparts, hitting top speeds of up to 230 mph right out of the gate.

For the FXX K, it's worth noting that it surprisingly prioritizes handling over raw speed, making it ideal for demanding tracks in the game where control trumps top speed. This lets it outshine other hypercars in unexpected ways. The Ferrari 599XX Evo, by contrast, bridges Formula One and production cars, sitting firmly in the realm of elite performance and reflecting Ferrari's identity as a racing team first, automaker second. That said, players can still expect excellent handling from this one, too.

13 Pagani Huayra

Top Speed: 223 mph

  • Cost to Buy: 671,999 Bucks
  • Performance Level: 240

Powered by a 6.0L Mercedes-Benz M158 twin-turbocharged V12 engine handmade by AMG, the Pagani Huayra is a gem among the Italian manufacturer's rich hypercar lineup, several of which rank among the fastest cars in The Crew 2 . The successor to the iconic Pagani Zonda, the Huayra shares some visual traits while showcasing a more modern, fluid design with sweeping curves instead of the aggressive straight lines of its predecessor. But it's not just about looks ‚Äî every design choice prioritizes maximizing the hypercar's aerodynamics.

The Pagani Huayra's entire body is crafted from carbon fiber and titanium, creating a lightweight yet sturdy frame. Featuring gullwing doors and two pairs of aerodynamic flaps (one at the front and another at the rear), it generates downforce at high speeds nearing 200 mph.

12 Creators Tempesta

Top Speed: 224 mph

  • Cost to Buy: 1,118,319 Bucks
  • Performance Level: 261

Designed by Matteo Gentile, the Creators Tempesta's look comes from the sharp angles used in Italian design. In the front and back, it looks especially menacing. The word "storm" translates to the Italian word "Tempesta." This is a reference to the MotorFilx episode "Into the Storm."

On January 18, 2023, The Crew 2 added the Creators Tempesta to the game as part of the Blizzard Rush episode. Only people with an S7/E2 MotorPass can buy it. Players can get it for free as soon as they hit the 37th level of the MotorPass.

11 Noble M600

Top Speed: 224 mph

  • Cost to Buy: 727,439 Bucks
  • Performance Level: 256

The Noble M600, a high-end hand-built British hypercar from the renowned Noble Automotive, is a true masterpiece of power and refinement. Capable of exceeding 220 mph even before performance upgrades in The Crew 2 , this hypercar combines breathtaking speed with exceptional craftsmanship. Constructed primarily from stainless steel and carbon fiber, the M600's lightweight design enhances its precise cornering, quick responsiveness, and exhilarating engine sound, delivering a driving experience that feels both raw and sophisticated.

In The Crew 2 , the Noble M600 is available in three distinct variants: the original Coupe model, known for its iconic silhouette and pure performance, the Carbon Sport variant, which features a stunning colored carbon finish that adds a layer of aesthetic sophistication, and the convertible Speedster variant that allows players to experience open-air hypercar driving. Regardless of the variant chosen, the Noble M600 offers an unparalleled blend of performance and style, making it a must-have for any player seeking the thrill of elite hypercar racing.

10 Gordon Murray Automotive T.50

Top Speed: 225 mph

  • Cost to Buy: 323,679 Bucks
  • Performance Level: 253

The Gordon Murray Automotive T.50 (short for Type 50) is a British supercar hailed as the spiritual successor to the iconic McLaren F1. Just like the F1, the T.50 features a central driving position rarely seen among production-built hypercars. It also achieves one of the highest power-to-weight ratios in its class, thanks to a remarkably light dry weight of just 997 kg.

Under the hood, the T.50 is powered by a 4.0L naturally aspirated V12 engine developed by Cosworth that revs up to an astonishing 12,100 RPM. Producing 654 horsepower, this engine delivers blistering performance, enabling the T.50 to reach speeds exceeding 220 mph, placing it among the fastest cars available in The Crew 2 ‚Äî and one of the most affordable for its performance. Combining cutting-edge technology with an homage to automotive history, the Gordon Murray T.50 is a must-have for car enthusiasts seeking a fast and reliable hypercar that embodies both innovation and tradition.

9 Citro√´n GT

Top Speed: 233 mph

  • Cost to Buy: 1,321,599 Bucks
  • Performance Level: 236

The Citro√´n GT is not only one of the fastest but also easily one of the most extraordinary hypercars in The Crew 2, a blend of cutting-edge design and high-octane performance. Originally developed as a concept car for the Gran Turismo series in collaboration with Polyphony Digital, this rare masterpiece of a vehicle never saw full production, with Citro√´n's initial plan to build six units ultimately abandoned due to the project's high cost. For players, the chance to get behind the wheel of this iconic vehicle in The Crew 2 is a thrilling opportunity to experience a car that exists more in the virtual world than reality.

The Citro√´n GT was designed by Takumi Yamamoto and boasts a strikingly futuristic design, featuring an ultra-wide body that looks more like something out of a sci-fi movie than a traditional Citro√´n lineup. Its performance matches its dramatic looks, as it is powered by a modified 5.4L Ford Modular V8 engine. Producing a hefty 646 horsepower, the car reaches an impressive top speed exceeding 230 mph, securing its place as one of the fastest cars in The Crew 2 .

8 Koenigsegg CCR

Top Speed: 245 mph

  • Cost to Buy: 1,330,559 Bucks
  • Performance Level: 264

The Koenigsegg CCR isn't the highest-performing Koenigsegg in The Crew 2 , given that it was created twenty years ago, yet it can still outpace many newer hypercars in the game with ease. Built as the successor to the iconic CC8S, the CCR held the title of the manufacturer's fastest car for quite some time before stepping aside for newer, more extreme models like the Agera, Jesko, Regera, and Gemera.

Only 14 units of the Koenigsegg CCR were ever produced. This exclusive hypercar is equipped with a 4.7L twin-supercharged V8 engine (based on the Ford Modular engine), capable of producing 806 horsepower, giving it an impressive top speed of 245 mph in The Crew 2 .

7 Pagani Zonda R

Top Speed: 247 mph

  • Cost to Buy: 366,239 Bucks
  • Performance Level: 260

The Pagani Zonda R is the top choice for fans of Pagani Automobili in The Crew 2 for several reasons. As the highest-performing Pagani model in the game, it can reach a top speed of 247 mph, outpacing the Huayra. What sets the Zonda R apart from other powerful hypercars in the game is its relatively moderate price, given its performance. It is more than five times cheaper than the Bugatti Divo, which is the most expensive of the fastest cars in the game.

With only 15 units of the Pagani Zonda R ever built, it is one of the rarest cars of its class that players can drive in The Crew 2 . Its 6.0L M120 V12 engine, developed by Mercedes-AMG, produces 750 horsepower, making it a true gem for car enthusiasts.

6 Saleen S7 Twin-Turbo

Top Speed: 248 mph

  • Cost to Buy: 683,199 Bucks
  • Performance Level: 244

The Saleen S7 Twin-Turbo is a rare breed of American hypercar, powerful and fast enough to compete with brands like Lamborghini, Bugatti, and Koenigsegg. Known for its body made entirely of carbon fiber, the S7 boasts a significantly reduced weight. Its high downforce ensures stability during high-speed turns, while its asymmetrical seat positioning ‚Äî closer to the car's center ‚Äî provides the driver with enhanced visibility.

At the heart of the Saleen S7 Twin-Turbo is a 7.0L twin-turbocharged Ford Windsor V8 engine, producing 750 horsepower, resulting in a top speed of about 248 mph. The Crew 2 also offers a special Glacier Edition of the S7, featuring the same performance specs but with a modified body kit, a transparent spoiler, and a teal paint job with an ice-themed livery.

5 Koenigsegg Gemera & Koenigsegg Regera

Top Speed: 248+ mph

  • Cost to Buy: 1,361,359-1,963,919 Bucks
  • Performance Levels : 286-291

The Koenigsegg Gemera and the Regera are both exceptional models from the renowned Swedish manufacturer, offering comparable performance but dramatically different designs. Both cars are among the fastest in The Crew 2 , reaching a top speed of 248 mph in their stock variants, and are some of the most expensive vehicles available in the game.

Limited to just 85 units, the Koenigsegg Regera (meaning "to rule" or "to reign") is equipped with a 5.0L twin-turbocharged V8 engine paired with three YASA electric motors, delivering a combined output of 1,500 horsepower. Meanwhile, the Gemera (meaning "to give more") ‚Äî a rare four-door model from Koenigsegg ‚Äî comes with an even more powerful 2.0L TFG twin-turbocharged I3 engine, producing 1,700 horsepower.

4 Bugatti Veyron 16.4 Grand Sport Vitesse & Bugatti Chiron

Top Speed: 255 mph

  • Cost to Buy: 1,674,399-1,987,999 Bucks
  • Performance Levels: 267-287

The Bugatti Veyron 16.4 Grand Sport Vitesse, like the Bugatti Chiron, may not be the fastest Bugatti in The Crew 2 ‚Äî falling slightly behind the Chiron Super Sport in top speed ‚Äî but when it comes to Bugatti, players can expect unmatched performance. Powered by an 8.0L quad-turbocharged W16 engine that delivers 1,183 horsepower, Veyron 16.4 Grand Sport Vitesse's acceleration and top speed will blow away anyone lucky enough to drive it on long highways.

The Crew 2 features multiple editions of the Veyron Grand Sport, including the Edition One and Deep Blue Edition. While each model boasts unique paintwork and slight variations in body details, such as a custom spoiler that folds during braking, all versions share the same base and engine. As a result, players can expect consistently high performance across all Veyron models in the game.

3 Bugatti Chiron Super Sport 300+

Top Speed: 273 mph

  • Cost to Buy: 1,957,199 Bucks
  • Performance Level: 290

The Bugatti Chiron Super Sport 300+ is a monstrous vehicle that is a quintessential example of a hypercar and is easily one of the fastest cars in The Crew 2 . It has a real-world record peak speed of 304 mph (273 mph in-game). The car's all-black body looks more dangerous due to the two orange stripes on its hood.

The car has a substantial 8.0-liter quad-turbocharged W16 engine under the hood. It offers 1,578 horsepower and turns 7,000 times per minute. Thus, the standard Chiron was upgraded with a more powerful engine with a higher top speed. Their distinctive paint schemes also featured lacquer-coated carbon fiber bodies with orange stripes.

2 Koenigsegg Agera R & Koenigsegg Jesko

Top Speed: 273 mph

  • Cost to Buy: 786,799-2,140,319 Bucks
  • Performance Levels: 281-294

Alongside the Bugatti Chiron Super Sport, the Koenigsegg Agera R ranks as one of the fastest cars players can acquire in The Crew 2 . Holding four spots in the rankings of the game's best and fastest hypercars, Koenigsegg's lineup can only be rivaled by Bugatti. These Swedish machines are some of the highest-performing cars in the game, having broken several production car speed records.

The Koenigsegg Agera R (Agera meaning "to act") is an upgraded version of the standard Agera, featuring more visible carbon fiber, new winglets, a revised exhaust system, increased engine power, and a raised RPM limit. With only 18 units ever built, the Agera R's exclusivity adds to its allure. Players might also want to consider the Koenigsegg Jesko, which boasts an astounding top speed of 270 mph and is another highly coveted hypercar from this iconic brand.

1 Koenigsegg One:1

Top Speed: 275+ mph

  • Cost to Buy: 1,685,599 Bucks
  • Performance Level: 301

What car could possibly outdo the Koenigsegg Agera R, Jesko, Regera, or Gemera, one might ask? The answer is unsurprising: Koenigsegg itself. The ultra-exclusive One:1 (One-to-One) is not only the fastest car in The Crew 2 but also the only hypercar with a performance level exceeding 300 right out of the gate. Essentially a modified, ultra-limited edition of the Agera R, the One:1 shares comparable stats, which makes sense. Koenigsegg even dubbed it the world's first megacar, a nod to its top-tier performance that leaves many hypercars in the dust.

With such unmatched prowess across the board, it's odd that the Koenigsegg One:1 isn't the priciest of the company's models in the game, coming in notably cheaper than the Jesko. Of course, price takes a backseat when discussing the fastest and most exclusive cars for cruising the map or dominating tracks, where the One:1's impressive stats, like a stock top speed of 275 mph, truly shine. Enthusiasts can likely coax even more from its potential, thanks to its unmatched power-to-weight ratio.

item.title: 8 Strongest Mages In Final Fantasy Games, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • The Final Fantasy series features powerful mages who can alter battle outcomes with their spells.
  • Characters like Garnet, Celes, and Yuna showcase unique magical abilities in different FF games.
  • Mages like Vivi and Rydia combine magic and summons, making them deadly in battles.

Final Fantasy is a series full of unforgettable characters that fans can't get enough of. From powerful knights to stealthy ninjas, there's no shortage of colorful characters in the series.

These games also feature all kinds of mages who wield a ton of power and can change the tide of battle with a single spell. This extends to magic users who operate in a support role, allowing them to buff the party and debilitate their opponents as the damage dealers become even more potent. From offensive spellcasters to supportive healers, these are the strongest mages in Final Fantasy games.

8 Garnet Til Alexandros XVII, Aka Dagger

A White Mage User Who Specializes In Summons

Your comment has not been saved

Final Fantasy 9
13
9.5 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Released
July 7, 2000

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Violence, Mild Language
Powered by

Princess Garnet was fed up with her mother's villainous actions and escaped the castle, choosing to tag along with Zidane and his group instead. She wasted no time in establishing herself as a powerful White Mage who could support the party while also calling upon the power of summons to dish out immense damage.

Unlike Eiko, Dagger is more adept at summoning and can call upon the power of some of the strongest beings in Final Fantasy 9 . This makes her a force to be reckoned with as she stomps over her opponents in style.

7 Lulu

Boasts A Plethora Of Black Magic

5 Images
5 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Final Fantasy 10
19
9.7 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Released
December 17, 2001

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Mild Blood, Mild Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Lulu is a Black Mage through and through, making her one of the most invaluable party members in Final Fantasy 10 . Her presence is a must in boss battles where players can exploit an enemy's elemental weaknesses to hit them for severe damage.

While her Overdrive may be lacking when compared to other party members, that takes nothing away from the power she wields with her impressive arsenal of black magic abilities.

6 Celes Chere

Became A Magitek Knight And Can Use Her Runic Powers To Absorb Magical Attacks

Your comment has not been saved

Final Fantasy 6
11
9 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Released
October 11, 1994

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Fantasy Violence, Partial Nudity
Powered by

Celes Chere was chosen to be part of an experiment by the empire that turned her into a Magitek Knight, allowing her to channel black magic to tear down her foes in style. This was augmented by her Runic command, which could absorb all forms of magic to negate their effects.

Players who were tactical with the use of Runic could negate the magical attacks of powerful foes and replenish Celes' MP in the process. If players were smart with their magicite allocation, then Celes' magical powers could become more potent than ever.

5 Vivi Ornitier

His Black Magic Abilities Make Him A Force To Be Reckoned With

Vivi personifies the look of the quintessential Black Mage and is one of the most beloved characters in all of Final Fantasy . Fans will shed a tear after learning of his origins, but that doesn't stop this charming magic user from aiding the party in saving the world from Kuja's horrid actions in Final Fantasy 9.

His black magic is extremely powerful and makes him a must-have in the party against tough bosses. He can partner up with Steiner to imbue his sword with powerful magic, enhancing the attacks of this valiant knight.

4 Terra Branford

A Half-Esper Who Can Transfer To Enhance Her Magical Power

Terra is left in the dark about her origins, only to find out that she was born from the unlikely union of an esper and a human. This makes her one of the most special characters in the series, and she can use her powers to great effect, especially if she transforms.

Her magical abilities are enhanced in this transformed state, making her more potent in battle. Players who enter boss battles with a high-level Terra can destroy their foes with ease, especially if she has access to high-level magic spells.

3 Rydia

Blends Black Magic With Summons For A Deadly Combination

6 Images
6 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Final Fantasy 4
7 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Released
July 19, 1991

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

Rydia is introduced as a young child who loses her mother after the village of Mist is decimated by bombings. In a fit of rage, she displays her power for the first time by summoning Titan and splitting both Cecil and Kain apart.

After being thrown overboard from a ship and seemingly swallowed by Leviathan, she is re-discovered in Feymarch. She honed her skills under Leviathan's watchful gaze, becoming a powerful summoner who can use potent black magic to obliterate her opponents.

2 Yuna

Summons Turn Yuna Into A Damage-Dealing Beast

Summons are overpowered in Final Fantasy 10 , which is why Yuna's abilities come in clutch against the game's toughest boss fights. It helps that her abilities as a White Mage allow her to serve a valuable support role in the party, too.

Whenever she summons an aeon, players get to control these mythical beasts as they decimate enemies with special attacks before using their Overdrive to unleash immense damage. This can be a game-changer in tough battles and makes it clear why Yuna is one of the most powerful mages in all of Final Fantasy .

1 Ultimecia

A Ridiculously Powerful Sorceress Who Can Compress Space And Time

Your comment has not been saved

Final Fantasy 8
10
9.8 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Released
February 11, 1999

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Mild Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Ultimecia is one of the most powerful mages in the Final Fantasy series. She is revealed to be the true antagonist of Final Fantasy 8 , who manipulated Edea behind the scenes and wants to compress all of space and time to bend to her will.

The final dungeon looks absolutely surreal as players explore her twisted domain and regain their abilities before finally taking on the sorceress herself. She's no joke, with the boss fight spanning four phases and easily overpowering the entire party unless they were diligent about their Junctions.

item.title: Vampire Survivors: How to Set Up Cross Save
item.description:
Cross save has finally arrived in Vampire Survivors , allowing players to sync their progress and unlocks across multiple platforms. There are some unfortunate restrictions in place, however, and PlayStation users in particular will be disappointed by the current Vampire Survivors cross save implementation.

Cross progression has been teased for Vampire Survivors for quite some time, but now it has arrived alongside the free Emerald Diorama expansion that adds a bunch of content from Square Enix's SaGa RPG franchise. Cross save for Vampire Survivors is super simple to set up , and more supported platforms may be added in future updates, too.

How to Set Up Cross Save in Vampire Survivors

To set up cross progression in Vampire Survivors and carry a save over to other platforms, players must first create a Poncle account. The cloud button in the top-left corner of the Vampire Survivors main menu will allow players to create an account and sync all of their data.

Once your Poncle account is created, save data from Vampire Survivors can be transferred to other platforms by logging into that Poncle account, selecting "My Account" followed by "Manage Data" and then "Save Data," and then pressing the "Save" button to push a save file into the Vampire Survivors cloud save slot. This cloud save can then be loaded onto other platforms by repeating this process and choosing "Load Data" instead of "Save Data" in the account menu. Cloud saves don't sync automatically, so players have to manually upload and download their save files before moving to another platform.

DLC cross-buy for expansions like Ode to Castlevania isn't supported in Vampire Survivors , but transferring save data to a platform where players don't own any DLC still works. In that instance, players just won't have access to the DLC if they don't own it on their current platform. All DLC options will be locked until the save data is downloaded onto a system where players own the correct expansions. Achievements may also unlock automatically when Vampire Survivors save data is downloaded, but this depends on the active platform.

Currently, Vampire Survivors cross saves are supported on Steam, Epic Games Store, Xbox, Android, and iOS. Nintendo Switch compatibility is coming soon. Unfortunately, cross save is not available on PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 5 at the moment because of a last-minute legal issue that the development team has encountered. The chances of cross save coming to PlayStation consoles are slim, but it could still potentially happen down the line. The same goes for the Apple Arcade version of Vampire Survivors , which does not currently support cross save.

item.title: Overwatch 2 Fan Shares Cyberpunk 2077 Skin Concepts
item.description:
Summary

  • A fan created Cyberpunk 2077-inspired skin concepts for Overwatch 2, generating excitement online.
  • These skin concepts include Genji as V, Sombra as Judy, and Cassidy as Johnny Silverhand.
  • Despite Overwatch 2 and Cyberpunk 2077's popularity, no official collaboration has been confirmed yet.

An inventive Overwatch 2 fan has created skin concepts based on Cyberpunk 2077 . Since the release of the crossover with One-Punch Man , the first in Overwatch 2 's history, the Blizzard shooter has been getting several crossover skins.

One of the most famous is the Overwatch 2 skins based on LE SSERAFIM, the popular K-pop group. The first wave of cosmetics was out in 2023, with new cosmetics released this year. For anime fans, there has been no shortage of exciting collaborations beyond One-Punch Man , such as skins based on other hits like My Hero Academia and Cowboy Bebop . Recently, an Overwatch 2 fan showed what it would be like if the Blizzard game teamed up with another equally popular title and got skins based on it.

Reddit user sincerelyv3sper shared their Cyberpunk 2077 skin concepts for four Overwatch 2 heroes. Their first idea turns Genji into V, the male version of Cyberpunk 2077 's protagonist, combining V's outfit with the ninja's cybernetics. They then imagine Sombra as Judy, the braindance techie and a Mox member who has a similar haircut to the Talon hacker. Cassidy was given a concept inspired by Johnny Silverhand, the popular character played by Keanu Reeves, who, like the cowboy, also has a mechanical left arm. The Juno skin concept is based on Songbird, the Federal Intelligence Agency's talented netrunner.

Overwatch 2 Still Doesn't Have Crossovers With Non-Blizzard Games

Other Redditors showed excitement about the OP's idea, reacting with more than 2,000 upvotes. The comments chose the skin concepts for Sombra and Cassidy as their favorites, while they shared their ideas for potential skins such as Hazard as Jackie, Widowmaker as Panam, and Ramattra as Adam Smasher. It's worth remembering that Overwatch 2 has crossover skins with games, but they are from other Blizzard properties like Diablo 4 , World of Warcraft , and StarCraft . Despite Overwatch 2 and Cyberpunk 2077 being two highly popular titles, the hero shooter's development team has not yet shown any official interest in such a collaboration.

While players wait to discover whether a crossover between Overwatch 2 and Cyberpunk 2077 might happen someday, Season 15 came with some big changes. The main one was the return of loot boxes to Overwatch 2 , as well as the introduction of the Perks system and new cosmetics. What comes next has also been revealed, with new hero Freja and hero bans coming in Season 16, map voting in Season 17, and the new hero Aqua in Season 18.

item.title: Schedule 1: Best Customers For Molly Presley
item.description:
Expanding your illegal business in Schedule 1 is a steep and steady process that players eventually tackle by simply following the main story questline, but a lot can be done to speed it up and increase the overall sale of products on the streets. Hiring new dealers is one of the easiest ways.

After working with Benji in the Northtown, players unlock Westville as the next available region to sell their materials to customers. Satisfying a handful of customers who are in a direct relationship with the neighborhood's dealer will eventually unlock access to Molly Presley.

Best Customers For Molly Presley In Schedule 1

Similar to Benji, Molly can also handle up to eight customers in Westville. However, the tastes of customers are different from the ones in Northtown, and Westville is a smaller neighborhood, though there are enough customers in the area to keep Molly busy.

As is the case with every dealer, it is almost essential to assign customers who are directly connected to Molly. You can always check the connection between customers via the Contacts app on your mobile phone. Here is the full list of customers that are best for Molly:

  • Kim Delany
  • Charles Rowland
  • Dean Webbster
  • George Greene
  • Jerry Montero
  • Doris Lubbin
  • Keith Wagner
  • Trent Sherman

Keep in mind that not all the customers shown on the Westville connection map are suitable for Molly. Some of these customers hang out quite far from Molly's location, and it will eventually require the dealer to traverse longer distances, hence selling fewer products within a day.

So, one important thing to note is to pay attention to customers' delivery locations before unlocking Molly. You can check out the history of delivery locations by reading the messages received from the customers.

Best Drug Type For Molly Presley In Schedule 1

Now that you know which customers are best for Molly, it's time to find a suitable drug type to supply the dealer with. Unlike Northtown, low-level drugs are not popular in Westville . Although you may have a decent business with OG Kush and Sour Diesel, it will really begin to ramp up once you give Molly Granddaddy Purple .

This material is quite popular in Westville, and the good news is that it has a higher base price compared to that of OG Kush or Sour Diesel.

That being said, Granddaddy Purple costs a little bit extra for the player, too. While it's OK to supply Molly with normal versions of Granddaddy Purple, it's highly recommended to produce and sell high-quality ones to customers that you deliver personally . Using a fertilizer is not a big deal, but it can quickly increase the satisfaction level of customers, and the best part is you can counter-offer the deals and charge some extra cash for the amount of fertilizer you use.
